body.p: The Board noted the following arguments in support of including a similar test in the revised Standard:

li.p: it would enhance the reliability of the goodwill impairment test by preventing the possibility of entities avoiding the recognition of impairment losses by using over‑optimistic cash flow projections in the value in use calculations.

it would provide useful information to users of an entity’s financial statements because a record of actual cash flows continually less than forecast cash flows tends to cast doubt on the reliability of current estimates.
